intro: Carphobolus oblongus, commonly known as the broadleaf cudweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellowish. Carphobolus oblongus plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small invertebrates.
